definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Luring [A7] students back from foreign campuses constitutes China's new class struggle[A8] .
sentences.chinese: 因此，吸引海外学生归囯成为了中囯新的阶级斗争。

sentences.english: Every class struggle is a political struggle.
sentences.chinese: 一切阶级斗争都是政治斗争。

sentences.english: Thirty years ago, he says acidly , "people were focused on class struggle."
sentences.chinese: 三十年前，他讽刺道，“人民关注于阶级斗争。

sentences.english: Class struggle is an objective reality, independent of man's will.
sentences.chinese: 阶级斗争是客观存在，不依人的意志为转移的。

sentences.english: The times that this is key link with class struggle before reforming and opening is adv unimaginably.
sentences.chinese: 这在改革开放前以阶级斗争为纲的时代是难以想象的。

sentences.english: Never be so bookish and naive as to treat complex class struggle as a simple matter.
sentences.chinese: 切不可书生气十足，把复杂的阶级斗争看得太简单了。

sentences.english: So do the wealthy look to you like the victims of class warfare?
sentences.chinese: 那么，你还能说富人就是阶级斗争的受害者？

sentences.english: In America class warfare involves peaceful protests by crunchy lefties using sign language to keep order.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，阶级斗争是举着标语的和平抗议活动。

sentences.english: Forget bail-out fatigue; the risk is class war.
sentences.chinese: 忘了救援疲劳，风险在于阶级斗争。

sentences.english: Ethnic struggle is also a form of class struggle.
sentences.chinese: 民族斗争也是阶级斗争的一种形式。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
